alert.note: Alert for Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Northern Virginia Blue Ridge (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 06 at 3:34AM EST until January 07 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches. * WHERE...Central Virginia Blue Ridge and Northern Virginia Blue Ridge. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 3 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening commute and the Friday morning commute, even after snow has ended. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is expected later this evening when snowfall rates of 1 inch per hour are possible. Visibility will be reduced to near or less than one- half mile snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Northern Virginia Blue Ridge
